description: Connector for Windows Shares (either CIFS or SMB) file systems. The Windows Share connector has been deprecated and may be removed in a future release. This connector will be superseded by the SMB2/3 connector.

parserId.description: Parser used when parsing raw content. Retry parsing setting is available under crawl performance (advance setting)
parserId.title: Parser

pipeline.description: Name of an existing index pipeline for processing documents.
pipeline.title: Pipeline ID

add_failed_docs.description: Set to true to add documents even if they partially fail processing. Failed documents will be added with as much metadata as available, but may not include all expected fields.
add_failed_docs.title: Add failed documents

bounds.description: Limits the crawl to a specific directory sub-tree, hostname or domain.
bounds.title: Crawl bounds

collection.description: Collection documents will be indexed to.
collection.title: Collection

commit_on_finish.description: Set to true for a request to be sent to Solr after the last batch has been fetched to commit the documents to the index.
commit_on_finish.title: Solr commit on finish

crawl_depth.description: Number of levels in a directory or site tree to descend for documents.
crawl_depth.title: Max crawl depth

crawl_item_timeout.description: Time in milliseconds to fetch any individual document.
crawl_item_timeout.title: Fetch timeout

db.description: Type and properties for a ConnectorDB implementation to use with this datasource.

aliases.description: Keep track of original URI-s that resolved to the current URI. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.
aliases.title: Process Aliases?

inlinks.description: Keep track of incoming links. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.
inlinks.title: Process Inlinks?

inv_aliases.description: Keep track of target URI-s that the current URI resolves to. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.
inv_aliases.title: Process Inverted Aliases?

type.description: Fully qualified class name of ConnectorDb implementation.
type.title: Implementation Class Name

db.title: Connector DB

enable_security_trimming.description: Set to true to fetch and index access control information from files.

ad_cache_groups.description: Set to true to enable caching of the Active Directory group hierarchy to speed up security trimming processes.
ad_cache_groups.title: Cache AD groups

ad_connect_timeout.description: Time in milliseconds for connecting to Active Directory. Default is 3000 ms.
ad_connect_timeout.title: AD connect timeout

ad_context_factory.description: The classname of the context factory to use to create the initial context.
ad_context_factory.title: AD context factory

ad_credentials.description: A password for the User Principal.
ad_credentials.title: AD credentials

ad_group_base_dn.description: Active Directory node or directory where group objects reside.
ad_group_base_dn.title: AD group base DN

ad_group_filter.description: Valid LDAP filter to find group objects in Active Directory, such as '(&(objectclass=group))'.
ad_group_filter.title: AD group filter

ad_read_timeout.description: Time in milliseconds for reading responses from Active Directory. Default is 5000 ms.
ad_read_timeout.title: AD read timeout

ad_read_token_groups.description: Set to true to read groups using TOKEN_GROUPS. Only applied if 'Cache AD groups' is disabled.
ad_read_token_groups.title: Read AD token groups

ad_referral.description: The method for processing referrals encountered by the service provider.
ad_referral.title: AD referral

ad_security_authentication.description: The type of security authentication to use.
ad_security_authentication.title: AD security authentication

ad_url.description: Fully qualified URL of the LDAP or AD server where user information is stored, in the format: 'ldap:://hostname:389' or 'ldap://hostname:636'.
ad_url.title: Active Directory URL

ad_user_base_dn.description: Active Directory node or directory where user objects reside.
ad_user_base_dn.title: AD user base DN

ad_user_filter.description: Valid LDAP filter to find user objects in Active Directory, such as '(&(objectclass=user)(sAMAccountName={0}))'.
ad_user_filter.title: AD user filter

ad_user_principal_name.description: A User Principal with permissions to access the Active Directory server in the format user@domain.
ad_user_principal_name.title: AD User Principal

cache_element_expiration_time.description: Time in seconds to store items in the caches. The default is 7200 seconds (2 hours).
cache_element_expiration_time.title: SIDS cache expiration time

enable_SIDs_cache.description: Set to true to cache user SIDs to reduce the number of Active Directory requests.
enable_SIDs_cache.title: Cache user SIDs

max_cache_size.description: Maximum number of items to store in the SIDS cache before refreshing. The default is 100 items.
max_cache_size.title: Maximum SIDS cache size

enable_security_trimming.title: Enable security trimming

exclude_paths.description: Regular expressions for URI patterns to exclude. This will limit this datasource to only URIs that do not match the regular expression.
exclude_paths.title: Exclusive regexes

include_extensions.description: List the file extensions to be fetched. Note: Files with possible matching MIME types but non-matching file extensions will be skipped. Extensions should be listed without periods, using whitespace to separate items (e.g., 'pdf zip').
include_extensions.title: Included file extensions

include_paths.description: Regular expressions for URI patterns to include. This will limit this datasource to only URIs that match the regular expression.
include_paths.title: Inclusive regexes

index_directories.description: Set to true to add directories to the index as documents. If set to false, directories will not be added to the index, but they will still be traversed for documents.
index_directories.title: Index directories

initial_mapping.description: Provides mapping of fields before documents are sent to an index pipeline.

condition.description: Define a conditional script that must result in true or false. This can be used to determine if the stage should process or not.
condition.title: Condition

label.description: A unique label for this stage.
label.title: Label

operation.description: The type of mapping to perform: move, copy, delete, add, set, or keep.
operation.title: Operation

source.description: The name of the field to be mapped.
source.title: Source Field

target.description: The name of the field to be mapped to.
target.title: Target Field

skip.description: Set to true to skip this stage.
skip.title: Skip This Stage

unmapped.description: If fields do not match any of the field mapping rules, these rules will apply.

operation.description: The type of mapping to perform: move, copy, delete, add, set, or keep.
operation.title: Operation

source.description: The name of the field to be mapped.
source.title: Source Field

target.description: The name of the field to be mapped to.
target.title: Target Field

unmapped.title: Unmapped Fields

initial_mapping.title: Initial field mapping

kerberos_keytab.description: Full path to the Kerberos keytab file.
kerberos_keytab.title: Kerberos keytab

max_bytes.description: Maximum size (in bytes) of documents to fetch or -1 for unlimited file size.
max_bytes.title: Maximum file size (bytes)

max_docs.description: Maximum number of documents to fetch. The default (-1) means no limit.
max_docs.title: Max items

max_threads.description: The maximum number of threads to use for fetching data. Note: Each thread will create a new connection to the repository, which may make overall throughput faster, but this also requires more system resources, including CPU and memory.
max_threads.title: Fetch threads

maximum_connections.description: Maximum number of concurrent connections to the filesystem. A large number of documents could cause a large number of simultaneous connections to the repository and lead to errors or degraded performance. In some cases, reducing this number may help performance issues.
maximum_connections.title: Maximum fetch connections

password.description: Password for the user. Do not set a password if Kerberos authentication is used.
password.title: Password

url.description: A starting URI for this datasource. The URI must be fully-qualified, and include the protocol, host, port and path, as appropriate.
url.title: Start link

username.description: A user in the Windows domain with READ permissions for the Windows Share. Do not set username if Kerberos authentication is used.
username.title: Username

verify_access.description: Set to true to require successful connection to the filesystem before saving this datasource.
verify_access.title: Validate access

windows_domain.description: Authentication domain for the user. Not required if using Kerberos authentication.
windows_domain.title: Windows Domain

with_kerberos.description: Select to use Kerberos for authentication instead of username and password. Kerberos authentication requires information for the advanced properties 'Kerberos principal' and 'Kerberos keytab'. If 'false', Username and Password must be entered.
with_kerberos.title: Use Kerberos Authentication

type.description: Datasource type supported by the selected connector type.
type.title: Datasource Type

type_description.default: Connector for Windows Shares (either CIFS or SMB) file systems. The Windows Share connector has been deprecated and may be removed in a future release. This connector will be superseded by the SMB2/3 connector.
type_description.title: Type Description

title: Windows Share (deprecated)
